title: Rhythm in paint (TEFC)
creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
brief_description: Explains that rhythm begins with a thought in writing and a motif in music and painting. Eliot O’Hara and Margaret Shepher show how rhythmic patterns in painting are created, starting with a line, a curve or an angle. Depicts rhythm and its creative function in the artist’s treatment of a chosen motif. Choreography and dancing by Patricia Kaye.
